image.alt: Strouse Orthodontics banner with smiling patients and team

paragraphs.text: Welcome to Strouse Orthodontics, a patient-centered practice led by Dr. Eric Strouse. We provide advanced, custom orthodontic care for children and adults using modern digital scanning and face-first treatment planning.

Our team focuses on comfort, clear communication, and treatment options that match your lifestyle, including metal and clear braces, Invisalign<sup>®</sup>, early two-phase treatment, and surgical orthodontics when necessary. Schedule a complimentary consultation at one of our two convenient locations to begin your journey to a confident smile.

items.title: Locally Owned
items.text: Dr. Strouse leads a locally owned practice that treats patients like family with a focus on community and continuity of care.

items.title: Custom Planning
items.text: We use face-first treatment planning and 3D digital scans to design individualized plans — no cookie-cutter approaches.

items.title: Comfort + Tech
items.text: State-of-the-art tools like iTero digital scanning and in-house 3D technology help reduce discomfort and speed treatment.

items.title: Two Offices
items.text: Two convenient offices in Spring Hill and Lecanto plus flexible financing make care accessible for families.

paragraphs.text: Dr. Eric Strouse, DMD, MDS, completed dental training and an orthodontic residency with advanced study in 3D imaging and clear aligner techniques. He practices face-first treatment planning, creating custom treatment plans that fit each patient’s facial features and lifestyle. Dr. Strouse emphasizes comfort, modern digital workflows, and continuing education to deliver predictable, efficient results.

image.alt: Dr. Eric Strouse, orthodontist at Strouse Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Dr. Wexler is the founder of the practice and remains an important part of its legacy. The founder page highlights long-standing family and community involvement; the practice continues that tradition with patient-focused care and local engagement.

image.alt: Dr. Wexler and family, practice founders

paragraphs.text: From traditional braces to Invisalign<sup>®</sup> clear aligners, we offer personalized options for children, teens, and adults. Printable palatal expander instructions are available: https://www.sesamehub.com/sesame_media/docs/palatal-expander.pdf

image.alt: Invisalign treatment video thumbnail
Before and after case treated with metal braces
Case example suitable for clear ceramic braces
Palatal expander appliance

testimonials.author: Refka S
testimonials.testimonial: “Dr. Strouse is the best. He takes his time to answer all my questions (which happen to be so many)! The staff is very accommodating and friendly. I highly recommend that you send all your family and friends there. I had a great experience. I also loved how I didn’t have to get those separators.”

testimonials.author: Stephanie M
testimonials.testimonial: “Dr. Strouse is knowledgeable and answered all my questions. He also eased my son's concerns. The staff is excellent, friendly and efficient. The office is getting a much‑needed update and looks nicer now.”

testimonials.author: Gabe T
testimonials.testimonial: “Great office staff and doctor. They are extremely helpful, knowledgeable, and willing to do monthly payments with you! So thankful I found them! I would highly recommend this orthodontist to anyone looking for braces or Invisalign.”

testimonials.author: Kristi G
testimonials.testimonial: “Clean, friendly staff, and the wait once you arrive for your appointment is minimal. If you have a problem in between appointments they make it a priority to see you.”

image.alt: Strouse Orthodontics social banner
Family enjoying time together

seo.page_keywords: orthodontics, Invisalign, braces, Spring Hill, Lecanto, Strouse Orthodontics

og_meta.title: Home - Strouse Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Strouse Orthodontics provides personalized orthodontic care in Spring Hill and Lecanto, FL, offering braces, Invisalign®, expanders, and flexible financing.

image.alt: Orthodontic team smiling in a bright, welcoming practice lobby

paragraphs.text: Dr. Eric Strouse’s mission is simple: help people gain the confidence to chase their dreams by creating the smile they’ve always wanted. We deliver advanced orthodontic care in a welcoming, family-friendly environment that blends modern technology with genuine human connection.

We put patients first with face-first treatment planning, custom appliances when needed, and efficient care designed to reduce visits and discomfort. Our practice offers a full range of options including braces, clear/ceramic selections, and Invisalign<sup>®</sup> when appropriate.

Comfort and quality matter to us. We use digital iTero scanning, 3D printing, and modern techniques to streamline treatment and improve outcomes, while keeping appointments convenient and predictable for busy families.
Above all, we build relationships. From the first consultation through retention, our goal is that every patient feels listened to, cared for, and proud of their new smile.

image.alt: Dr. Eric Strouse smiling in the office

paragraphs.text: I became an orthodontist because of the confidence braces gave me as a teen, and I’m driven to give that same life-changing result to others. My approach is face-first: I design treatment to enhance each patient’s facial features so the final smile looks natural and balanced.

At the practice I provide comprehensive orthodontic care for children, teens, and adults, including braces, clear ceramic options, Invisalign<sup>®</sup>, and dentofacial orthopedics when needed. I focus on clear communication, thoughtful planning, and delivering comfortable, efficient treatment.

image.alt: Dr. Eric Strouse consulting with a patient

paragraphs.text: Education: Bachelor of Science in Biology from Muhlenberg College; Doctorate of Dental Medicine from the University of Connecticut School of Dental Medicine; general practice residency at St. Luke’s Hospital; orthodontic residency and Master of Science in dental science at Rutgers University.
My master’s thesis focused on 3D printing in orthodontics, and that interest in digital workflows influences how we plan and deliver care at the practice.

image.alt: Dr. Eric Strouse in the treatment room

paragraphs.text: I’m committed to ongoing training and am active in study clubs and national meetings. I completed advanced training in Invisalign<sup>®</sup> clear aligner therapy including the Aligner Intensive Fellowship and regularly attend courses on new orthodontic techniques.
Staying current with technology and methods allows us to offer faster, more comfortable treatment without sacrificing results.

image.alt: Dr. Eric Strouse presenting at a continuing education event
Dr. Donald Wexler with family

paragraphs.text: Dr. Donald Wexler founded the practice with a family-focused, community-minded mission. Though retired, his legacy guides our commitment to thoughtful patient care and local involvement.

image.alt: Dr. Wexler supporting community events

paragraphs.text: The practice has long supported local charities and events, including the Humane Society, community health clinics, Alzheimer’s fundraisers, YMCA children’s programs, and many local fundraisers across Hernando and Citrus counties.

image.alt: Practice volunteering at a community event

paragraphs.text: Outside the office Dr. Wexler enjoys family time, tennis, travel, and volunteering. His example helped create a practice culture focused on service and long-term patient relationships.

image.alt: Dr. Wexler with family at a community fundraiser

items.name: Kennadi
items.bio: I make sure our patients receive convenient appointment times and that our daily schedule runs smoothly, welcoming every caller with a friendly voice.

image.alt: Practice team member smiling at reception

items.name: Julie
items.bio: I guide patients through their first visit, review treatment plans, discuss financial options, and coordinate treatment starts with clarity and care.

image.alt: Treatment coordinator assisting a family

items.name: Amy
items.bio: I create clear, customized payment plans, help families navigate insurance benefits, and handle claims so financial questions are simple and straightforward.

image.alt: Financial coordinator reviewing payment options

items.name: Tiffany
items.bio: I assist with digital scans, appliance placement and adjustments, and help keep appointments comfortable and efficient for patients of all ages.

image.alt: Clinical orthodontic assistant preparing instruments

items.name: Taylor
items.bio: I support clinical care, from digital photos to assisting in-office procedures, always focusing on patient comfort and a calm appointment experience.

image.alt: Orthodontic assistant smiling with a patient

items.name: Mariah
items.bio: I help with clinical procedures and patient education so every appointment leaves patients confident in their care plan.

image.alt: Clinical assistant assisting with patient comfort

paragraphs.text: Giving back to our community is part of who we are. The practice, guided by Dr. Wexler’s example, supports local charities such as the Humane Society, community health clinics, Alzheimer’s fundraisers, YMCA children’s programs, and a variety of local school and nonprofit events across Hernando and Citrus counties.

We participate in community events, sponsor youth programs, and partner with local organizations to improve access to care. Those connections allow us to build relationships that span generations across Spring Hill, Lecanto, Brooksville, Crystal River, and neighboring towns.

image.alt: Graphic representing community support and local partnerships
Family enjoying time together

og_meta.title: About Us | Strouse Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Meet Dr. Eric Strouse and our team. We provide modern, comfortable orthodontic care across Spring Hill and Lecanto.

image.alt: Smiling family welcomed at Lakeshore Orthodontics front desk

paragraphs.text: Upload a few clear photos of your teeth and we’ll prepare a preliminary treatment plan as soon as possible. No appointment is required — this is a quick, convenient way to get professional feedback from our team.
You’ll complete a short form and attach your photos. After we review them, we’ll contact you with recommended next steps and any options for treatment or an in‑office visit.

image.alt: Father with daughter at reception of dentist's surgery

paragraphs.text: We accept most major dental and orthodontic insurance plans and can file claims electronically to make visits smoother for you.
If you need help budgeting for treatment, ask our treatment coordinator about flexible payment plans and interest‑free options that may be available.

To save time at your visit, please complete the forms below. Use the virtual consultation form to upload photos if you’d like a remote treatment review, or use the patient portal if you’re already registered with our practice.

image.alt: Patient filling out orthodontic health history forms online
Family enjoying time together

seo.page_description: Start a virtual orthodontic consultation: upload photos, get a preliminary treatment plan, and access patient forms. Fast, convenient, no appointment needed.
seo.page_keywords: virtual consultation, orthodontic consultation, patient forms, virtual exam, patient portal

og_meta.title: Get Started | Virtual Consultation
og_meta.description: Upload photos for a remote orthodontic review and get guidance on next steps. No appointment required.

image.alt: Smiling patients of all ages at Lakeshore Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Two‑phase treatment gives growing children the best chance at a healthy, stable smile. Early care guides jaw development, creates room for permanent teeth, and can reduce the need for extractions or more invasive work later.
Phase One focuses on guiding jaw growth and creating space for permanent teeth. Records like models, X‑rays, and photos help determine the right timing and appliances for each child.

image.alt: Young patient receiving early orthodontic intervention

paragraphs.text: After initial correction we monitor eruption and let permanent teeth settle into place. Some cases require recall visits every six months before the final phase begins.

image.alt: Smiling family enjoying time together

paragraphs.text: Phase Two usually begins once all permanent teeth have erupted and completes tooth positions with full upper and lower braces, followed by retainers to preserve results.

image.alt: Phase one treatment results
Smiling family enjoying time together

paragraphs.text: Invisalign4 uses removable, virtually invisible aligners made from SmartTrack4 material to move teeth precisely. It’s a discreet option that lets you eat and clean normally during treatment.
We combine digital scanning and 3D treatment planning to design a custom series of aligners and review progress with regular check‑ins every six weeks on average.

image.alt: Close-up of Invisalign aligners being placed on teeth

paragraphs.text: Modern metal braces are smaller and more comfortable than in the past, offering a durable, cost‑effective way to correct a wide range of orthodontic issues for teens and adults.
Metal brackets and wires apply controlled forces to shift teeth into their ideal positions. They’re often the most efficient option for complex movements.

image.alt: Dental Checkup with Braces
Two stylish smiling teens taking selfie with braces

paragraphs.text: Ceramic braces offer a less‑visible alternative to metal braces while delivering effective tooth movement. They’re a popular choice for patients who want a more aesthetic appliance.

image.alt: Smiling Woman with Clear Aligner

paragraphs.text: Palatal expanders help widen the upper jaw in growing patients to create space for permanent teeth and improve how the upper and lower arches fit together.

image.alt: Modern dentist office interior with advanced technology

paragraphs.text: When jaw discrepancies are severe and growth is complete, orthognathic surgery in coordination with orthodontic care can restore function, balance, and facial harmony.
Surgery is performed by an oral and maxillofacial surgeon in a hospital setting. After healing, braces are used to fine‑tune the bite, and retainers keep your results long term.

image.alt: Orthodontic patient receiving orthognathic surgical consultation

paragraphs.text: After active treatment, retainers maintain tooth positions. We offer removable and fixed options and provide clear instructions to protect your investment in a new smile.
The quoted treatment fee includes at least one set of Essix clear retainers; regular follow‑up helps ensure long‑term stability.

image.alt: Beautiful young Asian woman smiling and holding orthodontic retainer

paragraphs.text: The Synapse device offers a needle‑free, drug‑free option to reduce oral discomfort during procedures and aftercare. It can be used to ease sensitivity and improve patient comfort for many dental and orthodontic needs.

image.alt: Enjoying Time Together
Family enjoying time together

paragraphs.text: Find answers to common questions about treatment options, virtual consultations, scheduling, and payment plans at Strouse Orthodontics.

accordion.header: What orthodontic treatments do you offer?

paragraphs.text: We provide traditional metal and ceramic braces, clear Invisalign<sup>®</sup> aligners for discreet treatment, and custom retainers to help protect your new smile.

image.alt: Happy Family Portrait

accordion.header: Can I start with a virtual consultation?

paragraphs.text: Yes. Upload a few photos of your smile and we will propose a preliminary plan. Start the virtual consult form: https://secure.sesamesmile.com/forms/13284/22385/fTgp/form.html

image.alt: Couple Enjoying Time Together

accordion.header: At what age should my child see an orthodontist?

paragraphs.text: The American Association of Orthodontists recommends an evaluation by age 7. Early visits let us monitor growth and plan treatment only if needed.

image.alt: Collaborative Team Spirit Moment

accordion.header: How long does treatment typically take?

paragraphs.text: Treatment time varies by case. Many patients complete care within 12 to 24 months, and we’ll provide a personalized timeline during your consultation.

image.alt: Smiling Man Working at Desk

accordion.header: What payment and insurance options are available?

paragraphs.text: We accept most PPO insurance plans and offer flexible monthly payment options. Our quoted treatment fee is all-inclusive and may cover appliances, scheduled visits, and one set of Essix retainers; we’ll review your benefits and financing at your free consultation.

image.alt: Mother and Daughter Smiling Together

accordion.header: How can I schedule an appointment?

paragraphs.text: Schedule online through our appointment request page: https://www.strouseorthodontics.com/appointment-request. You can also start with a virtual consult via https://secure.sesamesmile.com/forms/13284/22385/fTgp/form.html.

image.alt: Mother and Daughter Smiling Together
Family enjoying time together
